alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 1:50PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...An area of heavier snow showers with a few embedded squalls will impact portions of southwestern Clinton, southern Franklin, southeastern St. Lawrence and northwestern Essex Counties through 230 PM EST... At 148 PM EST, scattered snow showers, some heavy were located across the southern third of St. Lawrence County, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds 25 mph or greater, and visibility as low as one quarter mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Tupper Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Saranac Lake, Oswegatchie, Piercefield, Wawbeek, Degrasse, Carry Falls Reservoir, Cranberry Lake, Star Lake, Madawaska, Harrietstown, Fine, Pitcairn, Stark, Edwards, Paul Smiths, Union Falls, Conifer and Saranac Inn.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex
